new_subanswers_ys:
A1: The pattern in the transformation of the input grid to the output grid is as follows:
A2: Yes, the output grid is always a 5x6 grid. The transformation seems to be based on the presence of certain numbers in the input grid. Specifically, the number 7 and 2 seem to play a role in the transformation. 
A3: Yes, the number 2 acts as a divider in the input grid. The transformation seems to be based on the presence of the number 7 in the six columns to the left and right of the number 2. If there is at least one number 7 in a column, the corresponding cell in the output grid is 1, otherwise it is 0. 
A4: Yes, the output grid is formed by the cells to the left and right of the number 2 in the input grid. The transformation seems to be based on the presence of the number 7 in the six columns to the left and right of the number 2. If there is at least one number 7 in a column, the corresponding cell in the output grid is 1, otherwise it is 0.
A5: The transformation rule is not directly based on the individual cells in the input grid, but rather on the columns. If there is at least one number 7 in a column to the left or right of the number 2 in the input grid, the corresponding cell in the output grid is 1. If there is no number 7 in a column, the corresponding cell in the output grid is 0.
